title: U.S. Housing Wealth Skewed Even More Toward Affluent Over Past Decade
sub_head: From 2010 to 2020, about 71% of increase in housing wealth was gained by high-income households, says National Association of Realtors report
body:
The past decadeâ€™s booming residential real-estate market has enriched almost every U.S. homeowner, but the gains have largely benefited the wealthiest, a new analysis shows.
From 2010 to 2020, about 71% of the increase in housing wealth was gained by high-income households, according to a report released Wednesday by the National Association of Realtors.
